com.onenetwork.backchain.client

Interface BackchainClient

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    EthereumClient

    public interface BackchainClient
    Interface for interacting with the Backchain. Acquire an instance via BackchainClientFactory.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getHash(long index)
      Hashes are stored to the Backchain sequentially in insertion order.
      java.lang.String getOrchestrator()
      Returns the address of the entity acting as the Orchestrator for the Backchain.
      long hashCount()
      Returns the total number of hashes stored in the backchain.
      void post(java.lang.String hash)
      Posts a new hash to the Backchain.
      boolean verify(java.lang.String hash)
      Returns true if the given hash is present in the Backchain, false otherwise.

    • Method Detail

      • getHash

        java.lang.String getHash(long index)
        Hashes are stored to the Backchain sequentially in insertion order. This method returns the hash stored at the given index (starting from zero).
        Parameters:
        index - index of the desired hash (starting from zero)
        Returns:
        hash at the given index

      • getOrchestrator

        java.lang.String getOrchestrator()
        Returns the address of the entity acting as the Orchestrator for the Backchain.
        Returns:
        address of the entity acting as the Orchestrator for the Backchain

      • hashCount

        long hashCount()
        Returns the total number of hashes stored in the backchain. See also @{link #getHash(index)}
        Returns:
        total number of hashes stored in the backchain

      • post

        void post(java.lang.String hash)
        Posts a new hash to the Backchain. Available only to the Orchestrator.
        Parameters:
        hash - new hash to the Backchain

      • verify

        boolean verify(java.lang.String hash)
        Returns true if the given hash is present in the Backchain, false otherwise.
        Parameters:
        hash - has to be verified
        Returns:
        true if the given hash is present in the Backchain, false otherwise
